intro: Gynoxys moritziana, commonly known as the red-flowered gynoxys, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy red bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered within the vibrant red bracts, creating a visually appealing contrast. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance. Gynoxys moritziana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as birds and insects.
